value: One of the roads that cross the Serra do Mar State Park.

as simply an area to be crossed on the way to the beach, the park is actually part of the
The Serra do Mar State Park is a dense rainforest area covering the hills around the central and north parts of the

coast. Although there are lower difficulty trails, it is mostly an area for serious trekking, not for a relaxing nature stroll or animal sightseeing. The most rewarding trails will bring you to beautiful waterfalls or splendid views of the coast.

For ecoutourism purposes, the park can be accessed by one of the 8 visitor centers. Some of them have regular operating hours, while others require booking a visit in advance. If you will visit the park through a tour agency, they will do the booking in your behalf.
